title: Vice President
description: I act as Vice President of Indy Miata Club, Inc, where I act in conjunction with the board in making decisions about the direction of the club and in planning driving, social, and outreach events for 130+ club members. We work with local charitable organizations to raise funds and periodically participate in volunteering events.

title: IFBI Hackathon
location: Indiana Farm Bureau Insurance's Second Annual Hackathon
description: I participated in the company's IoT-themed hackathon.  Our team demonstrated the practical applications of home sensors to the insurance industry and built a smart mirror, including a made-from-scratch frontend UI for it.

title: IFBI Hackathon
location: Indiana Farm Bureau Insurance's First Hackathon
description: I participated in the companyâ€™s first-ever hackathon. There was an insurance theme and 8 teams participated. Our team won second place for our simplified quoting concept that uses existing data from within the company and other sources to deliver demographics-driven quotes to potential customers while asking far less questions than would normally be required.

title: Nominated for Intern of the Year
description: I was nominated by Indiana Farm Bureau Insurance for intern of the year through Indiana INTERNnet.

title: Mission Trip: South Chicago
description: Our group of 12 went to southern Chicago for a week to help run a daycare for financially restricted families. While there, I filmed and edited a video to summarize the experience, which you can watch via the link below.

title: Computer Graphics
location: The Net - Connection Pointe Christian Church
description: The Net is a young adults group that meets every other Sunday. I assist with set-up, create visual elements and loops, and manage the on-screen lyrics and notes during the service.
